Chinese cities are facing the financial abyss of their subway systems
subhead: After high-speed rail, subway lines are now dragging down the cities they serve. The blame lies with colossal construction and operating costs, minimal revenues and a toxic relationship with real estate developers.

title: Trump delays TikTok ban again, grants app 90-day extension to find US buyer
subhead: This is the third reprieve for TikTok. Chinese owner ByteDance has until September 17 to sell the app's US operations or face a nationwide ban.

title: Wolfgang Tillmans' photography in action
subhead: Ever since his start in the 1980s, the world-renowned German visual artist has explored every genre of photography. As the Centre Pompidou in Paris prepares to close for five years for major renovations, his abundant work has taken over the Public Information Library (Bpi).

title: At the heart of the Arctic, the 'Noah's Ark for plants' welcomes new seeds
subhead: Since 2008, 1.3 million seed varieties from 128 countries have been deposited in the global seed vault, located in Norway's Svalbard archipelago. It serves as a life insurance policy in case of disaster.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Macron calls for a European-led diplomatic solution

title: Tolerance holding up in France despite hate speech, report on racism finds
subhead: After a turbulent 2023 marked by the consequences of the terrorist attacks by Hamas, French people's acceptance of others again increased in 2024, according to the National Consultative Commission on Human Rights' annual study. But prejudice persists.
